reviewText: I saw this back when it came out.  It was part of a Double Feature, and I thought that I wouldn't enjoy it. I wasn't a Dabney Coleman fan, and thought to myself that I could sit through an hour and a half of "whatever."  My perception about this movie was TOTALLY WRONG!I loved it, and every time it comes on HBO or cable, I watch it. Dabney Coleman portrays a "short-timer" brilliantly and I became a fan of his after this movie. It is extremely funny and goes to show you that life is short, even though his really wasn't as short as he thought. It also went on showing me that don't judge a movie by who is in it.Great Movie!  Hurry and release it on DVD.

reviewText: "Short Time" has never been properly released on DVD in the United States.  What this means is any DVDs floating around of it are bootlegs or foreign versions.  This is problematic because bootlegs are illegal and of dodgy quality while foreign versions are typically not viewable on North American DVD players because of region encoding.For people who are not familiar with region encoding -- the United States and Canada are in region 1 and most DVD and blu-ray players sold in this region only play region 1 encoded DVDs.  Europe is in Region 2 so discs from there (such as Short Time) will only play on European Region 2 compatible DVD players.However, all is not lost -- there are two ways to watch region 2 DVDs in North America. The easiest one is to purchase a region-free DVD player like Sony DVP-SR320 All Multi Region Zone Code Free DVD PlayerOr if you're like me and want to go the more complicated route, you can buy the region 2 DVD and create an MP4 file from it using an encoder such as Handbrake.  Once you've got it on your hard drive it has been stripped of it's region encoding and you can stream it to you TV via a streaming box like an AppleTV.
summary: Anybody in North America who wants this movie on DVD -- READ THIS.
